answers.answer: What makes you think nobody read it?
Alright AR-10, I'm not getting into it with you if you are still "slightly mad" according to your profile:)BTW, Beetlejuice is a fav of mine:)

Autoimmune Disorders CommunityDiscussionsMembersThis is an un-mediated Patient-to-Patient Forum only. This forum is for questions and support regarding Autoimmune topics such as: Acute disseminated encephalomyelitis (ADEM), Addison's disease, Ankylosing spondylitis, Antiphospholipid antibody syndrome (APS), Aplastic anemia, Autoimmune hepatitis, Autoimmune Oophoritis, Celiac disease, Crohn's disease, Diabetes mellitus type 1, Gestational pemphigoid, Goodpasture's syndrome, Graves' disease, Guillain-Barré syndrome (GBS), Hashimoto's disease, Idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura, Kawasaki's Disease, Lupus erythematosus, Multiple sclerosis, Myasthenia gravis, Opsoclonus myoclonus syndrome (OMS), Optic neuritis, Ord's Pemphigus, Pernicious anemia, Polyarthritis, Primary biliary cirrhosis, Rheumatoid arthritis, Reiter's syndrome, Sjögren's syndrome, Takayasu's arteritis, Temporal arteritis, Warm autoimmune hemolytic anemia, Wegener's granulomatosis
I'm just saying, posting the same thread twice in twenty minutes because no one replied  to the first one is...odd.And I am still "slightly mad".We all have our little quirks. :)

I went there.I saw a lot of things I don't want to know about right now.I relize that once you have an auto-immune disorder, you are prone to aquiring others.I have my hands full with Hashimoto's Toxicosis.I am not really keen on learning about Lupus or Addison's right now.But thanks for the heads up!
You make me laugh.I just thought I'd made one where I get straight to the point.I tend to ramble....

You get up early, too.LOL!!We didn't get off on a very good start, did we? I've been as you say, a little moody. My spelling gets worse by the day, too.I'll try to be less abrasive in the future.I try to find as much humor in this as I can, but this past week has been very stressful.Sorry.
what has been your prognosis with Hashimotos Toxicosis?  What are your symptoms and how do you know u have it?

Yeah--it is time to read--usually I'm not on medhelp that early in the morning.I read your post on your profile, and I determined that you have been under a lot of stress so I just didn't worry about the abrasiveness.It will get better--it should get better.
BTW, I am a little ODD:)
BTW, I am a little ODD:)

I don't know if it will answer your questions, but I just wrote a book about it in my journal.You can click on my profile and read it.If you have questions you can IM me.I'm off to nappy land.And chigirl29, odd is not bad. It's interesting.
Yeah I read it.  Its sounds like you have been through He//.  Sorry.  Hopefully you will feel better soon.

question: You can learn a lot about Grave's and Hash there as well:)Since no one is reading my other post about it--condensed version.
title: Autoimmune Forum
